medical_history.chief_complaint: Hematuria for the last week and right back/flank pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began one week ago with hematuria, described as ranging from bright red to tea-colored. The patient has also experienced intermittent chills and mild nausea, but denies vomiting. He has a normal appetite and bowel activity, and reports no melena or hematochezia. There is mild tenderness to palpation in the right lower quadrant.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Spontaneous pneumothorax x2; L VATS blebectomy; R knee arthroscopy.
medical_history.family_history: Denies any history of GU related malignancies. Parents and siblings healthy.
